cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 425 miles south of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest over the central Gulf, forecast to turn north then north-northeast and strike the central Louisiana coast before racing inland toward the lower Mississippi Valley

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from High Island, TX to Sabine Pass (west of the warning area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning east of Sabine Pass to Morgan City, LA; Storm Surge Warning Sabine Pass to Ocean Springs, MS including lakes Pontchartrain, Maurepas, and Borgne
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Louisiana shoreline from High Island, TX eastward to Ocean Springs, MS, with greatest effects centered on southwest and south-central Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (65%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds with a 22% chance of 50-kt winds and a 5% chance of hurricane-force gusts Friday into early Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Little direct surge threat this far upriver, though minor water-level rises are possible on the lower Mississippi due to backwater effects
weather_observation.rainfall: 5â€“10 inches with locally higher amounts up to 15 inches possible, leading to flash and urban flooding around Baton Rouge
weather_observation.other_hazards: Slight tornado risk late Thursday night through Friday; dangerous river currents and debris could hamper port operations
